title: Marcos Rojo backs Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer following draw against Liverpool
text:
Manchester United defender Marcus Rojo has thrown his backing behind under-fire manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer to succeed at Old Trafford.

The Red Devils have made a turbulent start to the season, their worst in 30 years, and sit 14th in the Premier League with 10 points from nine games.

But Solskjaer's men earned respect at the weekend by earning a 1-1 draw with league leaders Liverpool in a game they were expected to lose heavily in.

Marcus Rojo has been frozen out at United recently, but returned in the 1-1 draw with Liverpool

Argentine defender Rojo has been frozen out at United in recent seasons, featuring just five times in the league last season, although he made his return to Solskjaer's starting XI against the Reds - starting his first game of the campaign.

Speaking to the Athletic, he stressed that the Norwegian has the full support of the squad and that they believe in his ideas, despite some calls from supporters to bring in a new manager with a winning mentality.

'He's a good person,' he said. 'He has the long-term ideas to improve the team and I have confidence in him.

'Training is fine, we work hard but we know it's all about results and we know we have not been getting them.'

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is under pressure at Old Trafford with United languishing in mid-table

Marcos Rojo at United Appearances: 118 Goals: 2 Honours: FA Cup - 2015-16, EFL Cup - 2016-17, Community Shield - 2016, Europa League 2016-17

With Rojo making his comeback for United, and helping the side largely frustrate Liverpool to end their perfect start to the season, the 29-year-old will be hoping to kick on from here and hopes more appearances will lead to more games on the international stage.

Argentina will host the Copa America next summer, with the team captained by Lionel Messi hoping to finally lift a trophy, and Rojo is aiming to be a part of it.

'It's a big season for me - I want to play in Copa America in my home country next year too.'

Manchester United's next game is a trip to Partizan Belgrade in the Europa League on Thursday night before travelling to Carrow Road to play Norwich on Sunday.
